title: Senior Backend Engineer â€“ Wise Platform (Partnership Experience)
content:
Weâ€™re Wise, the network for the worldâ€™s money. We believe in money without borders. And our mission is to build the best way to move and manage the worldâ€™s money. Min fees. Max ease. Full speed. 
Current banking systems donâ€™t let us send, spend or receive money internationally very easily. Or quickly. Or cheaply.
So, we built a new one. And itâ€™s called Wise Platform.
Wise Platform helps banks, software companies and large enterprises leverage Wiseâ€™s infrastructure to offer their customers world class payment products through their own channels. 
Weâ€™re a cross functional team that sits across sales, account management, product, engineering, compliance, analytics and more. And weâ€™re global, with offices in New York, London, Singapore and beyond. 
Now weâ€™re looking for a Backend Engineer to join the Partnership Experience team and help us maintain our global platform so that itâ€™s scalable, reliable and secure. Weâ€™re working on a lot of algorithmical challenges, so youâ€™ll need to be someone whoâ€™s able to dive right into projects on reconciliation, integrations, authorisations and authentications. 
The Partnership Experience teamâ€™s goals are to provide Wise Platform partners with a fully self-serve experience to integrate with Wise, and to help them manage the live integration independently in a back office tool or via APIs in their existing tooling. Thanks to these goals, the Wise Platform team is able to focus on unblocking new, more complex products. 
Youâ€™ll be focussing on:

Designing and building scalable solutions to make the experience of working with Wise great for partners, customers and internal teams and allow partner operational teams to better manage the operational side of the partnership.
Building solutions to improve integration experience for partners integrating with Wise API.
Improving internal tooling that helps Wise operational teams serve our partnersâ€™ queries more efficiently.
Working closely with non-engineering teams to support partner integrations alongside product managers and embark on new and thrilling projects that expand our network of global partnerships.
Collaborating with talented engineering teams, exploring various domains, and contributing to over 700 Microservices at Wise.

Youâ€™ll have the opportunity to:

Choose your own path to success â€“ youâ€™ll have the freedom to define the vision and responsibility for making it happen.
Identify problems and unlock opportunities for Wise and partners through technology solutions.
Inspire teams with your ideas, knowledge and self-starter attitude.

What are we looking for? 

A strong product mindset and passion for user experience, you prioritise work with the customers in mind and make data-driven decisions to fix customer pain-points
Great communication skills and the ability to articulate complex, technical concepts to non-technical audiences
Ability to work independently while also being a good team player. Your work will frequently involve cross-team collaboration.
Ability to break down complex projects into incremental milestones that deliver customer value
Experience with common design and architectural patterns coupled with a passion for writing clean code that is performant and well tested 
Curiosity and drive for continuous learning and improvement
Following and advocating best coding practices, continuous delivery and code reviews
Experience working with relational and non-relational databases, query optimisation and designing schemas is a plus
Knowledge of Java and Spring boot and experience with a messaging system, like Kafka, is a plus
â€¦but donâ€™t worry we donâ€™t expect you to know everything.

Some extra skills that would be awesome:

Experience with our stack: Java within the Spring ecosystem, Kubernetes, AWS and service mesh architectures.
You have worked with distributed systems and monolithic architectures and understand the advantages and challenges of both.
Passion for international finance, foreign exchange and payment systems.
Demonstrated experience speaking at conferences and public events.

Hereâ€™s what youâ€™ll get in return:

The autonomy to solve problems your way.
The freedom to have real impact.
Loads of development opportunities.
A fun work environment with social activities and events.
The opportunity to work with super smart people.

Interested? Find out more:
ðŸ‘€ How we work - a practical guideðŸ“¹ Wise Vlogs: Omar, Engineering Lead ðŸ’» The Wise Tech Stack, 2022 editionðŸ“ˆ Our Engineering career mapðŸš€ Engineering career journeys at Wise
...or check out our  Engineering blog
#LI-JS1Salary (annual)Â£80,000â€”Â£115,000 GBPWe're people without borders â€” without judgement or prejudice, too. We believe teams are strongest when they are diverse, equitable and inclusive. We're proud to have a truly international team, and we celebrate our differences.
Every Wiser should feel that they can be themselves at work. Inclusive teams help us live our values and make sure every Wiser feels respected, empowered to share their contributions towards mission zero and able to progress in their careers.
Having diverse teams that reflect our diverse customer base helps us build a better product. We can be more creative and empathetic to our customer's needs and life experiences and makes sure we leave no-one behind on our journey to mission-zero.
If you want to find out more about what it's like to work at Wise visit Wise.Jobs.
Keep up to date with life at Wise by following us on LinkedIn and Instagram.

demographic_questions.header: Wise Diversity and Inclusion - Voluntary Demographic Questions
demographic_questions.description:
The following voluntary questions are intended to help us learn about the various identities and backgrounds that make up the candidates applying to Wise. If you don't feel comfortable answering you can select I don't wish to answer.

Providing us with this information will help us take actions that support underrepresented groups and make sure our hiring process is inclusive and fair for everyone.

The questions may be sensitive to some, please know your survey responses are secure and optional. All data will be handled anonymously, aggregated and not linked to you.There will be no adverse consequences if you do not wish to complete this questionnaire, or if you partially complete it or you select ‘prefer not to say’ to any question. It will in no way impact your opportunity to work for us within the application or hiring process.

Our privacy policy explains how we collect and process your data in accordance with applicable data protection laws. If you have any questions, please email hiring-privacy@wise.com.

questions.label: What gender identity do you most closely identify with?
I identify my race/ethnicity as (mark all that apply):

answer_options.label: Black or of African or Caribbean descent

questions.label: Do you live with a disability? (Disability covers mental and physical health impairments or conditions, including things like anxiety, visual or hearing impairments, long-term health conditions)
How did you hear about this job?

values.label: Job board (other than Glassdoor, LinkedIn or Indeed)

questions.label: Had you heard of Wise before you started your job search?
Have you used Wise as a customer?
Are you eligible to work in the UK?
Would you require VISA sponsorship and relocation support to live and work in the UK?
How many years of professional product engineering experience do you have?
What is your current notice period?
What is your desired gross salary in GBP?
